\begin{thm} \label{kathm}\cite{Ka4}
The following set of distributions
\[ 
{\mathfrak F}_{\rm\scriptscriptstyle E}^{\flat}\;\equiv\;
\big\{\,|\,{\rm d}_p\,\rangle \;;
\;p_s\in{\mathbb R}^+\,\big\},
\]
forms a basis for 
$L^2({\mathbb R})$
in the sense of generalized functions. We have the relations
\begin{equation} \label{orthcomp} \begin{aligned}
{} & \langle\,{\rm d}_p\,|\,{\rm d}_q\,\rangle = \;{\rm m}^{-1}(p)\,\delta(p-q)
\qquad\qquad\;\text{\rm (Orthogonality)}, \\
{}& 
\int_{{\mathbb R}^+}dp \;{\rm m}(p) \;|\,{\rm d}_p\,\rangle \langle\,{\rm d}_p\,|
\;= \;{\rm id} \qquad \qquad\text{\rm (Completeness)},
\end{aligned}\end{equation} 
where the measure $m(p)$ is defined as 
$m(p)=4\sinh 2\pi bp\,\sinh 2\pi b^{-1}p$.
